Package uk.ac.ed.inf.aqmaps.drone

Class MainDrone

java.lang.Object
uk.ac.ed.inf.aqmaps.drone.Drone
uk.ac.ed.inf.aqmaps.drone.MainDrone
public class MainDrone
extends Drone
The MainDrone class captures the properties of the drone that is used to take the sensor readings. It is different from the "ShadowDrone" in that there will only ever be one main drone, whereas shadow drones simply simulate the future steps of the main drone, thereby aiding its decision making.

  • Constructor Details

    • MainDrone

      public MainDrone​(com.mapbox.geojson.Point startingPosition, java.util.ArrayList<Sensor> tour, boolean verbose)
      The constructor of the MainDrone class
      Parameters:
      startingPosition - the position the drone starts at on move 0
      tour - the list of sensors the drone is expected to read
      verbose - whether we want the drone to print success messages to standard output

  • Method Details

    • completeTour

      public void completeTour()
      This acts as the "main method" of this class. The drone visits and reads all sensors in the given order and eventually returns to its starting location (if it hasn't crashed).

    • flyToCurrentDestination

      public int flyToCurrentDestination()
      This high-level method guides the drone to its next destination, returning the number of steps it took to get there after the method call was made.
      Returns:
      The number of steps the drone made to reach its destination

    • avoidObstacle

      public void avoidObstacle​(TwoDimensionalMapObject obstacleInOurWay)
      Given an obstacle which keeps the drone from moving straight towards its destination, this method lets the main drone spawn shadow drones to compare the cost of dodging the obstacle in a left/clockwise and in a right/counterclockwise manner. The moves of the shadow drone that yielded the more promising solution are then adopted. If both shadow drones fail their task for whatever reason, the drone crashes. This however did not happen once during testing.
      Parameters:
      obstacleInOurWay - the obstacle which last kept the drone from moving towards its destination.

    • readSensor

      private void readSensor​(Sensor sensor)
      This method is used to take a reading from a given sensor. This only works if the sensor is indeed in the required range. The reading is stored in order to later serve as part of the output of this application.
      Parameters:
      sensor - the sensor to be read

    • makeMove

      protected void makeMove​(int angle)
      This method is the only way in which our main drone can move. If this is impossible for whatever reason, the drone gives the appropriate response.
      Specified by:
      makeMove in class Drone
      Parameters:
      angle - the angle that specifies in what direction the drone should move.
